title: 50-B
statement: B. Choosing Symbol Pairstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutThere is a given stringSconsisting ofNsymbols. Your task is to find the number of ordered pairs of integersiandjsuch that1.1 ≤i,j≤N2.S[i] =S[j], that is thei-th symbol of stringSis equal to thej-th.InputThe single input line containsS, consisting of lowercase Latin letters and digits. It is guaranteed that stringSin not empty and its length does not exceed105.OutputPrint a single number which represents the number of pairsiandjwith the needed property. Pairs(x,y)and(y,x)should be considered different, i.e. the ordered pairs count.ExamplesInputgreat10Output7InputaaaaaaaaaaOutput100
